Questions.QuestionString: which type of damage is Skin not-perforated damage?
Answers: Abrasion, Lightning strike , Delamination, Scratches,  Dents, Holes, Gouges
Abrasion , Debonding, Delamination, Nicks, Dents, Holes, Gouges
Abrasion, Debonding, Delamination, Nicks, Dents, Gouges, Scratches

Questions.QuestionString: which type of damage is Skin perforated damage (with damage of fibres)?
Answers: Holes, Lightning strike, Impact by foreign object (FOD)
Abrasion , Debonding, Delamination, Nicks, Dents, Gouges, Scratches

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about Scratch damage?
Answers:
Scratch is damage to a surface caused by scuffing, rubbing or scraping of the
component. Fibres are not damaged and mechanical performance is not
affected.
Scratch is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due
to an adhesive failure
Scratch is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are
affected and the edges are sharp

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about Abrasion damage?
Answers:
Abrasion is damage to a surface caused by scuffing, rubbing or scraping of the
component. Fibres are not damaged and mechanical performance is not
affected.
Abrasion is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due
to an adhesive failure
Abrasion is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are
affected and the edges are sharp

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about Debonding damage?
Answers:
Debonding is damage to a surface caused by scuffing, rubbing or scraping of the
component. Fibres are not damaged and mechanical performance is not
affected.
Debonding is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due
to an adhesive failure
Debonding is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are
affected and the edges are sharp

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about Lightning Strike damage?
Answers:
The effect of a lightning strike depends on the material will not be the same.
For non-conductive materials like Glass- and Aramid Fibre a large part of the
component, if not completely protected, may be blown out because both skins
are affected and the core generally vapourised due to the extreme heat
The effect of a lightning strike is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive failure
The effect of a lightning strike is when the separation of plies occurs in a multi-laminate material. This can be caused by the material being hit (impact delamination), or
when there is a resin failure for any other reason.

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about Delamination damage?
Answers:
Delamination is a deformity caused by extraneous forces, which are
applied to the structure. This can be an impact (FOD) for example. 
Delamination  is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive failure
Delamination is when the separation of plies occurs in a multi-laminate
material. This can be caused by the material being hit (impact delamination), or
when there is a resin failure for any other reason.

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about Dent damage?
Answers:
A dent is a deformity caused by extraneous forces, which are
applied to the structure. This can be an impact (FOD) for example. 
A dent is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive failure
A dent is when the separation of plies occurs in a multi-laminate
material. This can be caused by the material being hit (impact delamination), or
when there is a resin failure for any other reason.

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about Erosion damage?
Answers:
Erosion is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are
affected and the edges are sharp.
Erosion could affect all the leading edge surfaces, especially when the initial
surface protection system has been damaged. Erosion, when undetected or
unrepaired, may generate composite deterioration.
Erosion principally affects the resin and is generally due to
accidental contact with aggressive chemical liquids or products (e.g. hydraulic
fluid).

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about Chemical Degradation damage?
Answers: Chemical Degradation is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are affected and the edges are sharp.

Chemical Degradation could affect all the leading edge surfaces, especially when the initial surface protection system has been damaged. Erosion, when undetected or unrepaired, may generate composite deterioration.

Chemical Degradation principally affects the resin and is generally due to
accidental contact with aggressive chemical liquids or products (e.g. hydraulic
fluid).

Questions.QuestionString: What testing methods can detect the presence of debonding and delaminations damages?
Answers: Tap Testing, Visual or optical inspection

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about Tap testing?
Answers:
Tap testing is only capable of finding flaws that are evident on the visible surface.
Internal flaws in composites (such as delaminations, disbonding and matrix
crazing) are not detectable. In addition, tight surface cracks and edge
delaminations may not be detectable.

Tap testing is extremely sensitive in measuring small surface defects. The part to be inspected is stressed by the application of heat, a static load or vibration to bring out the effect of the flaw on the surface displacement
Tap testing is widely used for the quick evaluation of any accessible aircraft surfaces to detect presence of debonding or entrapped water.

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about Radiography testing?
Answers:
Radiography is only capable of finding flaws that are evident on the visible surface.
Internal flaws in composites (such as delaminations, disbonding and matrix
crazing) are not detectable. In addition, tight surface cracks and edge
delaminations may not be detectable

Radiography is extremely sensitive in measuring small surface defects. The part to be inspected is stressed by the application of heat, a static load or vibration to bring out the effect of the flaw on the surface displacement
Radiography is a NDT technique that uses X−rays or gamma rays. A radiograph is a photographic record produced by the passage of these rays through a test object onto a film.

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about Ultrasonics testing?
Answers: Ultrasonic waves travel through solids and liquids at relatively high speeds, but are rapidly attenuated in gasses. The density and the elasticity of the medium may affect the wave speed. The technique is based on the attenuation of high-frequency (1 - 30 MHz) acoustic waves passing through the composite part

Ultrasonics is extremely sensitive in measuring small surface defects. The part to be inspected is stressed by the application of heat, a static load or vibration to bring out the effect of the flaw on the surface displacement
Ultrasonics is a NDT technique that uses X−rays or gamma rays. A radiograph is a photographic record produced by the passage of these rays through a test object onto a film.

Questions.QuestionString: What are the types of repairs on Composite parts?
Which of the following statements is correct about Repair through Injection of Resin?
Answers: Repair through Injection of Resin is recommended for small damages of the honeycomb material. The area is filled with thickened resin/hardener alloy and in the next step made plane. However, the repaired area has lost nearly the half of its original strength.

The repair through injection of resin is an approved repair for delamination or dissolving adhesives. If the damaged is caused by contamination or water absorption, this type of repair is not recommended.

Repair through Injection of Resin is typical for sandwich structures. It is easy to accomplish especially if the damaged parts are very small. Today two different repairs of sandwich parts can be accomplished:
_ Repair of the covering, if only one side of the covering and/or parts of the combs are damaged.
_ Repair of the covering, if both covering parts and the combs are damaged

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about Filling Repair?
Answers: Filling RepairResin is recommended for small damages of the honeycomb material. The area is filled with thickened resin/hardener alloy and in the next step made plane. However, the repaired area has lost nearly the half of its original strength.
Filling Repair is an approved repair for delamination or dissolving adhesives. If the damage is caused by contamination or water absorption, this type of repair is not recommended.

Filling Repair is typical for sandwich structures. It is easy to accomplish especially if the damaged parts are very small. Today two different repairs of sandwich parts can be accomplished:
_ Repair of the covering, if only one side of the covering and/or parts of the combs are damaged.
_ Repair of the covering, if both covering parts and the combs are damaged

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following statements is correct about the Repair of honeycombs and covering?
Answers: Repair of honeycombs and covering is recommended for small damages of the honeycomb material. The area is filled with thickened resin/hardener alloy and in the next step made plane. However, the repaired area has lost nearly the half of its original strength.
Repair of honeycombs and covering is an approved repair for delamination or dissolving adhesives. If the damage is caused by contamination or water absorption, this type of repair is not recommended

Repair of honeycombs and covering is typical for sandwich structures. It is easy to accomplish especially if the damaged parts are very small. Today two different repairs of sandwich parts can be accomplished:
_ Repair of the covering, if only one side of the covering and/or parts of the combs are damaged.
_ Repair of the covering, if both covering parts and the combs are damaged

Questions.QuestionString: What are the effects of Perforated Parting Film?
Answers: To prevent the bagging materials sticking to the repair surface. The film is perforated with small holes to allow air and gases to escape from the repair piles. Some resin will escape through the holes so, for repair, it is best to choose a film with pin-pricks to reduce the resin loss. Perforated parting film will produce a shiny, resin-rich surface on the repair.
To help even-out the temperature over the entire repair, help even-out the pressure over the whole repair and improve the flatness of the surface of the repair.
To allow the air and gases to escape easily

Questions.QuestionString: What are the effects of Caul Plate?
Answers: To prevent the bagging materials sticking to the repair surface. The film is perforated with small holes to allow air and gases to escape from the repair piles. Some resin will escape through the holes so, for repair, it is best to choose a film with pin-pricks to reduce the resin loss. Perforated parting film will produce a shiny, resin-rich surface on the repair.
To help even-out the temperature over the entire repair, help even-out the pressure over the whole repair and improve the flatness of the surface of the repair.
To allow the air and gases to escape easily

Questions.QuestionString: What are the effects of Breather Fabric?
Answers: To prevent the bagging materials sticking to the repair surface. The film is perforated with small holes to allow air and gases to escape from the repair piles. Some resin will escape through the holes so, for repair, it is best to choose a film with pin-pricks to reduce the resin loss. Perforated parting film will produce a shiny, resin-rich surface on the repair.
To help even-out the temperature over the entire repair, help even-out the pressure over the whole repair and improve the flatness of the surface of the repair.
To allow the air and gases to escape easily

Questions.QuestionString: What are the effects of Peel Ply?
Answers: the main effect is on the surface finish of the repair. During the curing of the repair, the peel ply becomes lightly bonded to the surface resin. When it is removed it peels off the surface resin leaving a rough finish. This produces a surface which can be painted or bonded without further sanding.
To provide an easy path for air to escape and to absorb any resin which comes through the holes in the perforated parting film.
To prevent resin soaking through onto the other bagging materials and the heater blanket.

Questions.QuestionString: What are the effects of Non−Perforated Parting Film?
Answers: the main effect is on the surface finish of the repair. During the curing of the repair, the peel ply becomes lightly bonded to the surface resin. When it is removed it peels off the surface resin leaving a rough finish. This produces a surface which can be painted or bonded without further sanding.
To provide an easy path for air to escape and to absorb any resin which comes through the holes in the perforated parting film.
To prevent resin soaking through onto the other bagging materials and the heater blanket.

Questions.QuestionString: What are the effects of Bleeder Cloth?
Answers: the main effect is on the surface finish of the repair. During the curing of the repair, the peel ply becomes lightly bonded to the surface resin. When it is removed it peels off the surface resin leaving a rough finish. This produces a surface which can be painted or bonded without further sanding.
To provide an easy path for air to escape and to absorb any resin which comes through the holes in the perforated parting film.
To prevent resin soaking through onto the other bagging materials and the heater blanket.

Heater Blanket is used to seal the vacuum bag to the surface of the item under repair

Positively charged metal-ions are emitted to the electrolyte, and leave behind negatively charged electrodes in the metal

Yes, if it works under high temperature enviroment

Questions.QuestionString: Aluminum alloy has good corrosion resistance right?

Questions.QuestionString: With aluminum alloys are used on aircraft, which part plays the role of corrosion resistance
Answers: The main metal composition in the alloy will determine its corrosion resistance
Due to the low strength of aluminium alloy, it is unsuitable for aircraft structures
A thin layer of pure aluminium on surface is a means of corrosion protection

Questions.QuestionString: Why say Corrosion of metals is the tendency to return to their natural state?
Answers: Because in nature metals exist in the form of alloys
Because in nature, almost all metals exist in the form of noble metals, thus alloys tend to return to their metal oxides form
Because in nature, except some noble metals, almost metals do not exist in their pure form, exist only in the form of metal ores (oxides)

Questions.QuestionString: What are the basic conditions for the formation of corrosion?
Answers: Material, eviroment and the chemical reaction of material with eviroment
Material, inert gas and the chemical reaction of material with gas

Questions.QuestionString: In a mechanical joint between aluminum alloy and copper, which material will be corroded first
Answers: None of them, because they are corrosion resistance

Why aircraft fuselage structure joints use aluminum alloy rivets and not steel or monel rivets?
Answers: Because aluminum alloy rivets are easy to install
Because aluminum alloy rivets have better strength and less susceptible to corrosion than others
This will minimize corrosion due to the dissimilar metal of rivets and aircraft structures

Questions.QuestionString: When there is corrosion on aircraft strutures, what are its consequences ?
Answers: Aircraft structures are reduced mechanical strength, functional impairment or destroyed if these damaged atrutures are not repaired appropriately
The aircraft is not allowed to operate until the damaged structures are replaced

Questions.QuestionString: During routine aircraft maintenance, a fuel sample is usually taken for inspection. One of the purposes of this is to prevent corrosion in the fuel tank. Why?
Answers: Because in the fuel tank may have water and microorganisms can grow in the tank. This will cause corrosion of the fuel tank structure
Because the fuel in the tank can be mixed with the electrolyte solution, leading to electrochemical corrosion
Because the fuel in the tank can change its chemical structure, turning it into structural corrosive substances

Questions.QuestionString:

1: between aluminum alloy 2024 and tin, 
2: between 2024 and Zinc. 
In which joints aluminum alloy 2024 will be corroded first after a period of working time
Answers: In the joint between 2024 and Tin
In the joint between 2024 and Zinc
